Publication-Record.Reference: AMSTERDAM, ALLARD PIERSON MUSEUM 1 ~ , 32, FIGS.18 ~ , 64, PL.(276) 21.4.6

Publication.Publication-Name: Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of RF plate. From Tarentum. Paseas (Cerberus Painter). Last quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: Top: lower parts of a naked boy to right, facing a seated and draped male to left who is holding a rod. (Perhaps athlete and trainer (Hemelrijk)). Bottom: lower part of male rushing to right (perhaps komast, Bothmer).
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Top: to left of left figure, diagonally downward: [Επιδ]ρομος, retr.{3}.
Record.CAVI-Comments: On p. 1577 Beazley says: "The name [Epidromos] probably occurs on a fragmentary plate in Amsterdam, by Paseas." Apparently without kalos. Ex Arndt (no. 2474) and The Hague, Scheurleer collections. Of the ninse plates decorated by Paseas, this is by a different potter from the others (Bothmer) and also the only one decorated both at top and bottom.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} [which says only: `From Taranto.']. {2} According to Hemelrijk, Beazley wrongly used the Arndt number (2474) for the museum number which is actually 2856. {3} so the text and ARV[2]; the facs. in CVA has [--]ομος, retr. which is presumably wrong.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: ARV[2] (1963), 163/9, 1577. — J.M. Hemelrijk, CVA Amsterdam 1, Netherlands 6 (1988), pl. 21,4,6 (inscr. not visible), figs. 18 (facs. of inscr.) and 64 (profile). — Add.[2] (1989), 182. — Add.[2] (1989), 182{1}.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of RF plate. From Athens. Hermokrates. Late sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: Upper portion of a youth playing flutes.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: To his right, in two lines, the first upward, the second further out: hερμοκρα^τες{1}. | (ε)γραφσεν(2), both retr.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Second line `above' first (order 2 / 1): see AttScr (1990), 26, 37-38 and 65. Graef–Langlotz also says that the painter seems to have made a correction, for some letters have been erased below εγραφσεν. See further on this painter Acr. ii, 79 and especially 223.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} the flutes interfere. Before the heta Graef–Langlotz gives a V-shaped letter; a stroke may be visible in the photo. {2} the epsilon smeared.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of WG stemless cup{1}. Group of Negro Alabastra (Beazley){2}. First quarter fifth (Burow).
Record.CAVI-Subject: Int.: upper part of a African (an Ethiopean warrior?).
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Int.: above his head, perhaps a trace of a letter [so CVA: I think rightly: perhaps part of a low mu.]
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} plate, Beazley and others; but Bothmer saw it was from a stemless cup. {2} Painter of New York 21.131 (J. Neils).
